creator: Thibault, Jean-Baptiste, 1810-1879. (editor)
Perrault, Charles-Ovide, 1809-1837. (translator)
description: Thibault, Jean-Baptiste: 1810-1879. Ordained at Red River, 1833; active in founding and consolidating Catholic missions at trading posts and Métis settlements along the Saskatchewan and Churchill River systems, 1842-1852; returned to Quebec, 1872 (Morgan, Dominion annual register, 1879; Morice, Dictionnaire historique). // Perrault, Charles-Ovide: 1809-1837. // At head of title: "L.J.C. & M.I." Text in Cree syllabics; title in French and Cree. Sabin attributed the translation to Charles Ovide Perrault, and the preface to Thibault. Thibault also produced a later edition ( see Peel 473) , which was revised by Albert Lacombe ( see Peel 1624). Moulin revised and corrected two editions ( see Peel 2227 and 5363). See Pilling, Bibliography of the Algonquian languages , for other works attributed to Thibault.
